image.altText: A skyline view of Gaza showing two white phosphorus bombs exploding in the distance.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation into superannuation funds offering members "ethical" or "socially aware" options unearths millions of dollars of retirement savings invested in companies that make some of the most controversial and devastating weapons of war.

title.children: 'Totally immoral' weapons found in share holdings of Australian ethical super funds

image.altText: A composite image showing the logos of ANZ, NAB, CBA and Westpac banks.

props.synopsis: With banks under near-constant attack from malicious actors trying to access everything from money to personal information, Australia's major banks are ramping up cyber security and urging customers to be more educated about scams.

title.children: Major bank raises alarm bell on cyber 'warfare': Claims 'entire community is at risk'

image.altText: Jacqui lambie motion

props.synopsis: Veteran and Tasmanian senator Jacqui Lambie is emotional as she asks the Senate to condemn the defacing of war memorials. Follow live.

title.children: Jacqui Lambie's fury at war memorial defacing, Greens refuse to condemn in Senate

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A rare moment of unity during QT
Greens leader won't say if he's spoken to Payman

image.altText: A person holds onto some money.

props.synopsis: While we may have heard about these laws in the past, they don't take effect until today.Â

title.children: A number of new laws come into effect today. See how they could affect you

image.altText: a composite image shows a man with glasses pointing and a woman in a muslim headscarf smiling

props.synopsis: Fatima Payman's calculated defiance is also in many ways the worst outcome for Labor. This painful episode has shown the power of this one senator to unleash a seismic political disruptor inside the party. But the events of the past days have also revealed Payman's unexpected political ally within Labor.

title.children: Fatima Payman has won an unlikely ally, but her calculated defiance is in many ways the worst outcome for Labor

image.altText: Fraser Ellis speaks to the media outside court.

props.synopsis: South Australian Independent MP Fraser Ellis has been found guilty of four counts of deception over his misuse of the Country Members Accommodation Allowance.

title.children: South Australian MP found guilty on four counts of deception over his misuse of accomodation allowance

image.altText: Black writing saying "blood on your hands" on a concrete memorial.

props.synopsis: Memorial sites along Canberra's Anzac Parade near the Australian War Memorial are graffitied with comments relating to the ongoing conflict in Gaza.

title.children: War memorials on Canberra's Anzac Parade vandalised with comments relating to ongoing Gaza conflict

image.altText: stores burning on a main regional town

props.synopsis: Volunteers never imagined the centre would stay open so long. But it has been a long road to recovery â and the "face of Black Summer" is still rebuilding.

title.children: The town where Scott Morrison was heckled during Black Summer bushfires is finally closing the doors of its relief centre

image.altText: A plume of smoke and fire rises from a hillside where a rocket fell and detonated.

props.synopsis: What began as a static test of a new "Sky Dragon 3" rocket by a private Chinese space company ended in a fiery explosion following the rocket's accidental launch.Â

title.children: Chinese Space Pioneer's Sky Dragon 3 rocket detonates following accidental launch

image.altText: Timber crates in thawed, refrozen lake

props.synopsis: Wilkes Station in Antarctica has been abandoned since 1969. The site, with its old fuel drums, asbestos buildings and other waste, has been described by a French inspection team as "concerning" to the local environment.

title.children: 'It was truly abandoned': Decommissioned Antarctic base a pollution risk as French team calls on Australia to clean up

image.altText: a house with solar panels on the roof

props.synopsis: Australians being wrenched into the teeth of the energy transition can expect more change from today amid new prices, solar charges and government largesse.

title.children: New prices, solar charges, and government support all mean your power bill will be changing today

image.altText: Two old man's hands resting on a computer.

props.synopsis: Scammers posing as investment experts are grooming victims over the phone for weeks to gain their trust, before stealing their money.

title.children: Robert spent weeks on the phone talking to a 'financial advisor' in a scam that cost him thousands

image.altText: Muddy tyre tracks coming off a highway.

props.synopsis: Police say initial investigations into a fatal bus crash in north Queensland show the Greyhound bus travelled onto the wrong side of the road before colliding with a four-wheel drive towing a caravan.

title.children: Initial investigations show Greyhound bus travelled on wrong side of road before fatal collision, police say

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab looks at her phone.

props.synopsis: Labor senator Fatima Payman draws heavy fire from her colleagues on Monday morning after she was banished from the federal party for her defiance over Palestine.

title.children: Suspended for her Palestine vote, Labor's Fatima Payman is isolated from colleagues but has pockets of support

image.altText: Jill Clarke stands in front of three glasses of water with pink vapes inside.

props.synopsis: Jill's vaping dependence and attempts to quit became a social media journey followed by millions. Here's what she thinks about the changes to Australia's vaping laws.

title.children: Millions watched as Jill tried to quit vaping. Then something unexpected happened

image.altText: A screenshot of Louis Tomlinson alongside footage of his campsite Euros watch party.

props.synopsis: From One Direction's Louis Tomlinson saving the day for football fans to Avril Lavigne clearing out the main stage, here's what you might have missed from the final day of this year's Glastonbury Festival.Â

title.children: 'Man of the people' Louis Tomlinson smuggles TV into Glastonbury camp

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 is down 0.4 per cent heading into the afternoon session after Wall St faded at its close on Friday. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX down 0.4pc heading into afternoon session

ASX clawing back early losses, down 0.4%

image.altText: Two younger women, an older man and an older woman walking in front of a helicopter with a security guard in the background.

props.synopsis: Top US Democrats rule out the possibility of replacing President Joe Biden as the Democratic nominee after a feeble debate performance.Â

title.children: Biden family, top Democrats back president amid calls for him to quit 2024 race

image.altText: A poster with French writing on it and the pictures of a woman and a man smiling.

props.synopsis: After the first round of snap parliamentary elections, France is the closest it has been to having a far-right government since World War II. So, what does this all mean for France? How does it work? And will President Macron stay in power?Â

title.children: France's snap election: Why is it happening, who are the National Rally, and what's happening to Macron?

image.altText: Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone celebrates after world record

props.synopsis: Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone smashes the rest of the field at the US Olympic trials to set down a marker to all her rivals ahead of her Olympic title defence in Paris next month.

title.children: Reigning Olympic champion McLaughlin-Levrone sets frightening new 400m hurdles record

image.altText: A yellow sale sign advertising a newly built house is on the market.

props.synopsis: An expert panel of top economic forecasters expects the Reserve Bank to cut interest rates two to three times over the next 18 months, with the first cut likely in March.

title.children: What Australia's economy will look like in a year, according to 29 top forecasters

image.altText: Jude Bellingham's overhead kick against Slovakia

props.synopsis: A miraculous goal from Jude Bellingham saves England's Euros campaign, while 16-year-old Spanish wonderkid Lamine Yamal helps the tournament favourite survive a huge scare against Georgia. Here are the five quick hits from Monday morning's action at Euro 2024.Â

title.children: Five quick hits â An all-time great goal keeps England alive at the Euros as 16-year-old Spanish wonderkid equals Ronaldo record

image.altText: A protester throws confetti on the Wimbledon court

props.synopsis: Daria Saville's hopes of advancing past the first round at Wimbledon were ruined by circumstances entirely out of her control. This year she is hoping for a better slice of luck.Â

title.children: Daria Saville hoping to avoid protesters and 'distracting farting noises' as Wimbledon gets underway

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: Happy financial new year! Look back at the year that was in financial markets; which stocks performed best, what tanked and where analysts are focusing their attention over the coming 12 months.Â

title.children: Stocks that shot to the Moon, and companies that tanked: Our end of financial year review

image.altText: Orpheus Pledger running his hand through his hair with denim jacket over his shoulder.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Magistrates' Court heard Orpheus Pledger's victim had bruises on her face and signs of strangulation.

title.children: Former Home and Away star pleads guilty to violent attack on woman

image.altText: Intimate Partner Dashboard GrAPHIC

props.synopsis: The government launches an intimate partner homicide counter with stringent criteria that sets it apart from unofficial counters that have reported different numbers of women killed.

title.children: Government begins counting murdered women as three killed in as many days

image.altText: A logo says 'ASIC'.

props.synopsis: The Australian Securities and Investments Commission is timid and slow and was once described as "a haven for white-collar crime". A parliamentary inquiry due this week is expected to be brutal in its assessment of the regulator. Will its recommendations chart a path forward?

title.children: Insiders have been alarmed by ASIC's culture for years. Now a parliamentary inquiry will lay bare its flaws

image.altText: A man holding a bike helmet under his arm

props.synopsis: By allowing cyclists to ride in the centre of the road, Toowoomba's Pierce Street is changing conversations around transport and urban planning.

title.children: What happens when you give cyclists more rights on the road? This city is finding out

image.altText: A composite picture of Will Pryce, Nicho Hynes and James Tedesco

props.synopsis: Former Great Britain player Leon Pryce and his family made the 17,000km trip to watch son Will score a try on debut for Newcastle, Nicho Hynes struggles continue and the Storm, somehow, still win. Here's this week's NRL Round-Up.

title.children: NRL Round-Up: 'Ugly' Storm get it done again and a UK legend flies around the world for his son's debut

image.altText: A split image of three AFL players a Dockers player celebrating, an Essendon player looking serious and a Lions player smiling.

props.synopsis: Dockers stifle star Swans duo, Bombers battle to avoid history repeating, Lions' flag pathway begins to open. Here are the biggest talking points from every game of round 16.

title.children: AFL Round-Up: Dockers stifle star Swans duo, Bombers battle to avoid history repeating, Lions' flag pathway opening

image.altText: Mum doing downward dog yoga pose in lounge room with a young boy playing underneath her.

props.synopsis: As family demands increase, women's physical activity becomes more limited, but the same doesn't happen for men.

title.children: Men 'borrowing' free time from women is driving the gender exercise gap
